scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Now, fair Hippolyta, our nuptial hour

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Draws on apace; four happy days bring in

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Another moon: but, O, methinks, how slow

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: This old moon wanes! she lingers my desires,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Like to a step-dame or a dowager

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Long withering out a young man revenue.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HIPPOLYTA
line: Four days will quickly steep themselves in night;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HIPPOLYTA
line: Four nights will quickly dream away the time;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HIPPOLYTA
line: And then the moon, like to a silver bow

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HIPPOLYTA
line: New-bent in heaven, shall behold the night

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HIPPOLYTA
line: Of our solemnities.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Go, Philostrate,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Stir up the Athenian youth to merriments;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Awake the pert and nimble spirit of mirth;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Turn melancholy forth to funerals;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: The pale companion is not for our pomp.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Hippolyta, I woo'd thee with my sword,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: And won thy love, doing thee injuries;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: But I will wed thee in another key,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: With pomp, with triumph and with revelling.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Happy be Theseus, our renowned duke!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Thanks, good Egeus: what's the news with thee?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Full of vexation come I, with complaint

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Against my child, my daughter Hermia.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Stand forth, Demetrius. My noble lord,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: This man hath my consent to marry her.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Stand forth, Lysander: and my gracious duke,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: This man hath bewitch'd the bosom of my child;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Thou, thou, Lysander, thou hast given her rhymes,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: And interchanged love-tokens with my child:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Thou hast by moonlight at her window sung,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: With feigning voice verses of feigning love,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: And stolen the impression of her fantasy

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: With bracelets of thy hair, rings, gawds, conceits,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Knacks, trifles, nosegays, sweetmeats, messengers

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Of strong prevailment in unharden'd youth:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: With cunning hast thou filch'd my daughter's heart,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Turn'd her obedience, which is due to me,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: To stubborn harshness: and, my gracious duke,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Be it so she; will not here before your grace

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Consent to marry with Demetrius,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: I beg the ancient privilege of Athens,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: As she is mine, I may dispose of her:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Which shall be either to this gentleman

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Or to her death, according to our law

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Immediately provided in that case.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: What say you, Hermia? be advised fair maid:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: To you your father should be as a god;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: One that composed your beauties, yea, and one

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: To whom you are but as a form in wax

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: By him imprinted and within his power

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: To leave the figure or disfigure it.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Demetrius is a worthy gentleman.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: So is Lysander.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: In himself he is;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: But in this kind, wanting your father's voice,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: The other must be held the worthier.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I would my father look'd but with my eyes.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Rather your eyes must with his judgment look.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I do entreat your grace to pardon me.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I know not by what power I am made bold,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Nor how it may concern my modesty,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: In such a presence here to plead my thoughts;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: But I beseech your grace that I may know

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: The worst that may befall me in this case,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: If I refuse to wed Demetrius.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Either to die the death or to abjure

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: For ever the society of men.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Therefore, fair Hermia, question your desires;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Know of your youth, examine well your blood,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Whether, if you yield not to your father's choice,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: You can endure the livery of a nun,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: For aye to be in shady cloister mew'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: To live a barren sister all your life,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Chanting faint hymns to the cold fruitless moon.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Thrice-blessed they that master so their blood,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: To undergo such maiden pilgrimage;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: But earthlier happy is the rose distill'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Than that which withering on the virgin thorn

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Grows, lives and dies in single blessedness.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: So will I grow, so live, so die, my lord,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Ere I will my virgin patent up

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Unto his lordship, whose unwished yoke

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: My soul consents not to give sovereignty.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Take time to pause; and, by the nest new moon--

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: The sealing-day betwixt my love and me,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: For everlasting bond of fellowship--

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Upon that day either prepare to die

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: For disobedience to your father's will,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Or else to wed Demetrius, as he would;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Or on Diana's altar to protest

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: For aye austerity and single life.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Relent, sweet Hermia: and, Lysander, yield

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Thy crazed title to my certain right.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: You have her father's love, Demetrius;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Let me have Hermia's: do you marry him.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: Scornful Lysander! true, he hath my love,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: And what is mine my love shall render him.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: And she is mine, and all my right of her

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: I do estate unto Demetrius.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: I am, my lord, as well derived as he,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: As well possess'd; my love is more than his;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: My fortunes every way as fairly rank'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: If not with vantage, as Demetrius';

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And, which is more than all these boasts can be,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: I am beloved of beauteous Hermia:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Why should not I then prosecute my right?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Demetrius, I'll avouch it to his head,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Made love to Nedar's daughter, Helena,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And won her soul; and she, sweet lady, dotes,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Devoutly dotes, dotes in idolatry,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Upon this spotted and inconstant man.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: I must confess that I have heard so much,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: And with Demetrius thought to have spoke thereof;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: But, being over-full of self-affairs,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: My mind did lose it. But, Demetrius, come;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: And come, Egeus; you shall go with me,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: I have some private schooling for you both.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: For you, fair Hermia, look you arm yourself

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: To fit your fancies to your father's will;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Or else the law of Athens yields you up--

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Which by no means we may extenuate--

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: To death, or to a vow of single life.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Come, my Hippolyta: what cheer, my love?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Demetrius and Egeus, go along:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: I must employ you in some business

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Against our nuptial and confer with you

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: THESEUS
line: Of something nearly that concerns yourselves.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: EGEUS
line: With duty and desire we follow you.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: How now, my love! why is your cheek so pale?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: How chance the roses there do fade so fast?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Belike for want of rain, which I could well

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Beteem them from the tempest of my eyes.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Ay me! for aught that I could ever read,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Could ever hear by tale or history,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: The course of true love never did run smooth;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: But, either it was different in blood,--

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: O cross! too high to be enthrall'd to low.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Or else misgraffed in respect of years,--

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: O spite! too old to be engaged to young.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Or else it stood upon the choice of friends,--

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: O hell! to choose love by another's eyes.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Or, if there were a sympathy in choice,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: War, death, or sickness did lay siege to it,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Making it momentany as a sound,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Swift as a shadow, short as any dream;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Brief as the lightning in the collied night,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: That, in a spleen, unfolds both heaven and earth,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And ere a man hath power to say 'Behold!'

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: The jaws of darkness do devour it up:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: So quick bright things come to confusion.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: If then true lovers have been ever cross'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: It stands as an edict in destiny:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Then let us teach our trial patience,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Because it is a customary cross,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: As due to love as thoughts and dreams and sighs,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Wishes and tears, poor fancy's followers.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: A good persuasion: therefore, hear me, Hermia.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: I have a widow aunt, a dowager

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Of great revenue, and she hath no child:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: From Athens is her house remote seven leagues;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And she respects me as her only son.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: There, gentle Hermia, may I marry thee;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And to that place the sharp Athenian law

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Cannot pursue us. If thou lovest me then,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Steal forth thy father's house to-morrow night;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And in the wood, a league without the town,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Where I did meet thee once with Helena,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: To do observance to a morn of May,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: There will I stay for thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: My good Lysander!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I swear to thee, by Cupid's strongest bow,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: By his best arrow with the golden head,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: By the simplicity of Venus' doves,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: By that which knitteth souls and prospers loves,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And by that fire which burn'd the Carthage queen,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: When the false Troyan under sail was seen,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: By all the vows that ever men have broke,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: In number more than ever women spoke,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: In that same place thou hast appointed me,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: To-morrow truly will I meet with thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Keep promise, love. Look, here comes Helena.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: God speed fair Helena! whither away?

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Call you me fair? that fair again unsay.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Demetrius loves your fair: O happy fair!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Your eyes are lode-stars; and your tongue's sweet air

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: More tuneable than lark to shepherd's ear,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: When wheat is green, when hawthorn buds appear.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Sickness is catching: O, were favour so,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Yours would I catch, fair Hermia, ere I go;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: My ear should catch your voice, my eye your eye,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: My tongue should catch your tongue's sweet melody.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Were the world mine, Demetrius being bated,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: The rest I'd give to be to you translated.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: O, teach me how you look, and with what art

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: You sway the motion of Demetrius' heart.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I frown upon him, yet he loves me still.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: O that your frowns would teach my smiles such skill!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I give him curses, yet he gives me love.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: O that my prayers could such affection move!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: The more I hate, the more he follows me.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: The more I love, the more he hateth me.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: His folly, Helena, is no fault of mine.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: None, but your beauty: would that fault were mine!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Take comfort: he no more shall see my face;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Lysander and myself will fly this place.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Before the time I did Lysander see,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Seem'd Athens as a paradise to me:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: O, then, what graces in my love do dwell,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: That he hath turn'd a heaven unto a hell!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Helen, to you our minds we will unfold:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: To-morrow night, when Phoebe doth behold

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Her silver visage in the watery glass,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Decking with liquid pearl the bladed grass,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: A time that lovers' flights doth still conceal,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Through Athens' gates have we devised to steal.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And in the wood, where often you and I

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Upon faint primrose-beds were wont to lie,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Emptying our bosoms of their counsel sweet,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: There my Lysander and myself shall meet;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And thence from Athens turn away our eyes,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: To seek new friends and stranger companies.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Farewell, sweet playfellow: pray thou for us;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And good luck grant thee thy Demetrius!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Keep word, Lysander: we must starve our sight

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HERMIA
line: From lovers' food till morrow deep midnight.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: I will, my Hermia.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Helena, adieu:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: As you on him, Demetrius dote on you!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: How happy some o'er other some can be!

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Through Athens I am thought as fair as she.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: But what of that? Demetrius thinks not so;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: He will not know what all but he do know:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: And as he errs, doting on Hermia's eyes,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: So I, admiring of his qualities:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Things base and vile, folding no quantity,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Love can transpose to form and dignity:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: And therefore is wing'd Cupid painted blind:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Nor hath Love's mind of any judgement taste;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Wings and no eyes figure unheedy haste:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: And therefore is Love said to be a child,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Because in choice he is so oft beguiled.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: As waggish boys in game themselves forswear,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: So the boy Love is perjured every where:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: For ere Demetrius look'd on Hermia's eyne,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: He hail'd down oaths that he was only mine;

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: And when this hail some heat from Hermia felt,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: So he dissolved, and showers of oaths did melt.

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: I will go tell him of fair Hermia's flight:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Then to the wood will he to-morrow night

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: Pursue her; and for this intelligence

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: If I have thanks, it is a dear expense:

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: But herein mean I to enrich my pain,

scene: SCENE I.  Athens. The palace of THESEUS.
speaker: HELENA
line: To have his sight thither and back again.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Is all our company here?

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: You were best to call them generally, man by man,

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: according to the scrip.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Here is the scroll of every man's name, which is

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: thought fit, through all Athens, to play in our

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: interlude before the duke and the duchess, on his

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: wedding-day at night.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: First, good Peter Quince, say what the play treats

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: on, then read the names of the actors, and so grow

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: to a point.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Marry, our play is, The most lamentable comedy, and

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: most cruel death of Pyramus and Thisby.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: A very good piece of work, I assure you, and a

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: merry. Now, good Peter Quince, call forth your

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: actors by the scroll. Masters, spread yourselves.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Answer as I call you. Nick Bottom, the weaver.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Ready. Name what part I am for, and proceed.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: You, Nick Bottom, are set down for Pyramus.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: What is Pyramus? a lover, or a tyrant?

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: A lover, that kills himself most gallant for love.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: That will ask some tears in the true performing of

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: it: if I do it, let the audience look to their

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: eyes; I will move storms, I will condole in some

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: measure. To the rest: yet my chief humour is for a

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: tyrant: I could play Ercles rarely, or a part to

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: tear a cat in, to make all split.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: The raging rocks

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: And shivering shocks

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Shall break the locks

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Of prison gates;

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: And Phibbus' car

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Shall shine from far

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: And make and mar

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: The foolish Fates.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: This was lofty! Now name the rest of the players.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: This is Ercles' vein, a tyrant's vein; a lover is

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: more condoling.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Francis Flute, the bellows-mender.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: FLUTE
line: Here, Peter Quince.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Flute, you must take Thisby on you.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: FLUTE
line: What is Thisby? a wandering knight?

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: It is the lady that Pyramus must love.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: FLUTE
line: Nay, faith, let me not play a woman; I have a beard coming.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: That's all one: you shall play it in a mask, and

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: you may speak as small as you will.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: An I may hide my face, let me play Thisby too, I'll

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: speak in a monstrous little voice. 'Thisne,

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Thisne;' 'Ah, Pyramus, lover dear! thy Thisby dear,

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: and lady dear!'

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: No, no; you must play Pyramus: and, Flute, you Thisby.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Well, proceed.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Robin Starveling, the tailor.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: STARVELING
line: Here, Peter Quince.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Robin Starveling, you must play Thisby's mother.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Tom Snout, the tinker.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: SNOUT
line: Here, Peter Quince.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: You, Pyramus' father: myself, Thisby's father:

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Snug, the joiner; you, the lion's part: and, I

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: hope, here is a play fitted.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: SNUG
line: Have you the lion's part written? pray you, if it

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: SNUG
line: be, give it me, for I am slow of study.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: You may do it extempore, for it is nothing but roaring.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Let me play the lion too: I will roar, that I will

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: do any man's heart good to hear me; I will roar,

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: that I will make the duke say 'Let him roar again,

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: let him roar again.'

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: An you should do it too terribly, you would fright

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: the duchess and the ladies, that they would shriek;

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: and that were enough to hang us all.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: ALL
line: That would hang us, every mother's son.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: I grant you, friends, if that you should fright the

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: ladies out of their wits, they would have no more

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: discretion but to hang us: but I will aggravate my

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: voice so that I will roar you as gently as any

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: sucking dove; I will roar you an 'twere any

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: nightingale.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: You can play no part but Pyramus; for Pyramus is a

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: sweet-faced man; a proper man, as one shall see in a

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: summer's day; a most lovely gentleman-like man:

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: therefore you must needs play Pyramus.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Well, I will undertake it. What beard were I best

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: to play it in?

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Why, what you will.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: I will discharge it in either your straw-colour

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: beard, your orange-tawny beard, your purple-in-grain

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: beard, or your French-crown-colour beard, your

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: perfect yellow.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Some of your French crowns have no hair at all, and

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: then you will play bare-faced. But, masters, here

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: are your parts: and I am to entreat you, request

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: you and desire you, to con them by to-morrow night;

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: and meet me in the palace wood, a mile without the

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: town, by moonlight; there will we rehearse, for if

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: we meet in the city, we shall be dogged with

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: company, and our devices known. In the meantime I

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: will draw a bill of properties, such as our play

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: wants. I pray you, fail me not.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: We will meet; and there we may rehearse most

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: obscenely and courageously. Take pains; be perfect: adieu.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: QUINCE
line: At the duke's oak we meet.

scene: SCENE II.  Athens. QUINCE'S house.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Enough; hold or cut bow-strings.

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: How now, spirit! whither wander you?

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Over hill, over dale,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Thorough bush, thorough brier,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Over park, over pale,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Thorough flood, thorough fire,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: I do wander everywhere,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Swifter than the moon's sphere;

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: And I serve the fairy queen,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: To dew her orbs upon the green.

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: The cowslips tall her pensioners be:

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: In their gold coats spots you see;

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Those be rubies, fairy favours,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: In those freckles live their savours:

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: I must go seek some dewdrops here

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: And hang a pearl in every cowslip's ear.

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Farewell, thou lob of spirits; I'll be gone:

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Our queen and all our elves come here anon.

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: The king doth keep his revels here to-night:

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: Take heed the queen come not within his sight;

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: For Oberon is passing fell and wrath,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: Because that she as her attendant hath

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: A lovely boy, stolen from an Indian king;

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: She never had so sweet a changeling;

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: And jealous Oberon would have the child

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: Knight of his train, to trace the forests wild;

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: But she perforce withholds the loved boy,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: Crowns him with flowers and makes him all her joy:

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: And now they never meet in grove or green,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: By fountain clear, or spangled starlight sheen,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: But, they do square, that all their elves for fear

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: PUCK
line: Creep into acorn-cups and hide them there.

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Either I mistake your shape and making quite,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Or else you are that shrewd and knavish sprite

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Call'd Robin Goodfellow: are not you he

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: That frights the maidens of the villagery;

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Skim milk, and sometimes labour in the quern

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: And bootless make the breathless housewife churn;

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: And sometime make the drink to bear no barm;

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Mislead night-wanderers, laughing at their harm?

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: Those that Hobgoblin call you and sweet Puck,

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.
speaker: Fairy
line: You do their work, and they shall have good luck:

scene: SCENE I.  A wood near Athens.

speaker: HERMIA

speaker: HERMIA

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.

speaker: PUCK

speaker: LYSANDER
line: And never mayst thou come Lysander near!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER

speaker: HERMIA

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Ay me, for pity! what a dream was here!

line: Lysander, look how I do quake with fear:

line: Methought a serpent eat my heart away,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.

line: And you sat smiling at his cruel pray.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.

line: What, out of hearing? gone? no sound, no word?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.

line: you know, Pyramus and Thisby meet by moonlight.

speaker: SNOUT
line: Doth the moon shine that night we play our play?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: A calendar, a calendar! look in the almanac; find

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: out moonshine, find out moonshine.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Yes, it doth shine that night.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Why, then may you leave a casement of the great

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: chamber window, where we play, open, and the moon

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: may shine in at the casement.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Ay; or else one must come in with a bush of thorns

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: and a lanthorn, and say he comes to disfigure, or to

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: present, the person of Moonshine. Then, there is

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: another thing: we must have a wall in the great

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: chamber; for Pyramus and Thisby says the story, did

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: talk through the chink of a wall.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: SNOUT
line: You can never bring in a wall. What say you, Bottom?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Some man or other must present Wall: and let him

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: have some plaster, or some loam, or some rough-cast

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: about him, to signify wall; and let him hold his

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: fingers thus, and through that cranny shall Pyramus

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: and Thisby whisper.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: If that may be, then all is well. Come, sit down,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: every mother's son, and rehearse your parts.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Pyramus, you begin: when you have spoken your

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: speech, enter into that brake: and so every one

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: according to his cue.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: What hempen home-spuns have we swaggering here,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: So near the cradle of the fairy queen?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: What, a play toward! I'll be an auditor;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: An actor too, perhaps, if I see cause.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Speak, Pyramus. Thisby, stand forth.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Thisby, the flowers of odious savours sweet,--

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Odours, odours.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: --odours savours sweet:

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: So hath thy breath, my dearest Thisby dear.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: But hark, a voice! stay thou but here awhile,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: And by and by I will to thee appear.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: A stranger Pyramus than e'er played here.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: FLUTE
line: Must I speak now?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Ay, marry, must you; for you must understand he goes

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: but to see a noise that he heard, and is to come again.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: FLUTE
line: Most radiant Pyramus, most lily-white of hue,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: FLUTE
line: Of colour like the red rose on triumphant brier,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: FLUTE
line: Most brisky juvenal and eke most lovely Jew,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: FLUTE
line: As true as truest horse that yet would never tire,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: FLUTE
line: I'll meet thee, Pyramus, at Ninny's tomb.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: 'Ninus' tomb,' man: why, you must not speak that

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: yet; that you answer to Pyramus: you speak all your

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: part at once, cues and all Pyramus enter: your cue

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: is past; it is, 'never tire.'

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: FLUTE
line: O,--As true as truest horse, that yet would

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: FLUTE
line: never tire.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: If I were fair, Thisby, I were only thine.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: O monstrous! O strange! we are haunted. Pray,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: masters! fly, masters! Help!

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: I'll follow you, I'll lead you about a round,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: Through bog, through bush, through brake, through brier:

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: Sometime a horse I'll be, sometime a hound,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: A hog, a headless bear, sometime a fire;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: And neigh, and bark, and grunt, and roar, and burn,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PUCK
line: Like horse, hound, hog, bear, fire, at every turn.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Why do they run away? this is a knavery of them to

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: make me afeard.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: SNOUT
line: O Bottom, thou art changed! what do I see on thee?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: What do you see? you see an asshead of your own, do

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: you?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: Bless thee, Bottom! bless thee! thou art

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: QUINCE
line: translated.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: I see their knavery: this is to make an ass of me;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: to fright me, if they could. But I will not stir

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: from this place, do what they can: I will walk up

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: and down here, and I will sing, that they shall hear

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: I am not afraid.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: The ousel cock so black of hue,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: With orange-tawny bill,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: The throstle with his note so true,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: The wren with little quill,--

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Awaking  What angel wakes me from my flowery bed?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Sings

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: The finch, the sparrow and the lark,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: The plain-song cuckoo gray,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Whose note full many a man doth mark,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: And dares not answer nay;--

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: for, indeed, who would set his wit to so foolish

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: a bird? who would give a bird the lie, though he cry

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: 'cuckoo' never so?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: I pray thee, gentle mortal, sing again:

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Mine ear is much enamour'd of thy note;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: So is mine eye enthralled to thy shape;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: And thy fair virtue's force perforce doth move me

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: On the first view to say, to swear, I love thee.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Methinks, mistress, you should have little reason

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: for that: and yet, to say the truth, reason and

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: love keep little company together now-a-days; the

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: more the pity that some honest neighbours will not

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: make them friends. Nay, I can gleek upon occasion.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Thou art as wise as thou art beautiful.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Not so, neither: but if I had wit enough to get out

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: of this wood, I have enough to serve mine own turn.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Out of this wood do not desire to go:

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Thou shalt remain here, whether thou wilt or no.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: I am a spirit of no common rate;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: The summer still doth tend upon my state;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: And I do love thee: therefore, go with me;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: I'll give thee fairies to attend on thee,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: And they shall fetch thee jewels from the deep,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: And sing while thou on pressed flowers dost sleep;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: And I will purge thy mortal grossness so

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: That thou shalt like an airy spirit go.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Peaseblossom! Cobweb! Moth! and Mustardseed!

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PEASEBLOSSOM
line: Ready.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: COBWEB
line: And I.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: MOTH
line: And I.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: MUSTARDSEED
line: And I.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: ALL
line: Where shall we go?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Be kind and courteous to this gentleman;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Hop in his walks and gambol in his eyes;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Feed him with apricocks and dewberries,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: With purple grapes, green figs, and mulberries;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: The honey-bags steal from the humble-bees,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: And for night-tapers crop their waxen thighs

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: And light them at the fiery glow-worm's eyes,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: To have my love to bed and to arise;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: And pluck the wings from Painted butterflies

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: To fan the moonbeams from his sleeping eyes:

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Nod to him, elves, and do him courtesies.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PEASEBLOSSOM
line: Hail, mortal!

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: COBWEB
line: Hail!

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: MOTH
line: Hail!

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: MUSTARDSEED
line: Hail!

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: I cry your worship's mercy, heartily: I beseech your

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: worship's name.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: COBWEB
line: Cobweb.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: I shall desire you of more acquaintance, good Master

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Cobweb: if I cut my finger, I shall make bold with

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: you. Your name, honest gentleman?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: PEASEBLOSSOM
line: Peaseblossom.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: I pray you, commend me to Mistress Squash, your

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: mother, and to Master Peascod, your father. Good

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Master Peaseblossom, I shall desire you of more

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: acquaintance too. Your name, I beseech you, sir?

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: MUSTARDSEED
line: Mustardseed.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Good Master Mustardseed, I know your patience well:

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: that same cowardly, giant-like ox-beef hath

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.

line: devoured many a gentleman of your house: I promise

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: you your kindred had made my eyes water ere now. I

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: desire your more acquaintance, good Master

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: BOTTOM
line: Mustardseed.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Come, wait upon him; lead him to my bower.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: The moon methinks looks with a watery eye;

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: And when she weeps, weeps every little flower,

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Lamenting some enforced chastity.

scene: SCENE I.  The wood. TITANIA lying asleep.
speaker: TITANIA
line: Tie up my love's tongue bring him silently.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: I wonder if Titania be awaked;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Then, what it was that next came in her eye,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Which she must dote on in extremity.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Here comes my messenger.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: How now, mad spirit!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: What night-rule now about this haunted grove?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: My mistress with a monster is in love.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Near to her close and consecrated bower,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: While she was in her dull and sleeping hour,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: A crew of patches, rude mechanicals,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: That work for bread upon Athenian stalls,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Were met together to rehearse a play

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Intended for great Theseus' nuptial-day.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: The shallowest thick-skin of that barren sort,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Who Pyramus presented, in their sport

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Forsook his scene and enter'd in a brake

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: When I did him at this advantage take,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: An ass's nole I fixed on his head:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Anon his Thisbe must be answered,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And forth my mimic comes. When they him spy,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: As wild geese that the creeping fowler eye,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Or russet-pated choughs, many in sort,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Rising and cawing at the gun's report,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Sever themselves and madly sweep the sky,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: So, at his sight, away his fellows fly;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And, at our stamp, here o'er and o'er one falls;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: He murder cries and help from Athens calls.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Their sense thus weak, lost with their fears

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: thus strong,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Made senseless things begin to do them wrong;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: For briers and thorns at their apparel snatch;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Some sleeves, some hats, from yielders all

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: things catch.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: I led them on in this distracted fear,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And left sweet Pyramus translated there:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: When in that moment, so it came to pass,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Titania waked and straightway loved an ass.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: This falls out better than I could devise.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: But hast thou yet latch'd the Athenian's eyes

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
