line: With the love-juice, as I did bid thee do?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: I took him sleeping,--that is finish'd too,--

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And the Athenian woman by his side:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: That, when he waked, of force she must be eyed.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Stand close: this is the same Athenian.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: This is the woman, but not this the man.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: O, why rebuke you him that loves you so?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Lay breath so bitter on your bitter foe.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Now I but chide; but I should use thee worse,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: For thou, I fear, hast given me cause to curse,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: If thou hast slain Lysander in his sleep,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Being o'er shoes in blood, plunge in the deep,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And kill me too.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: The sun was not so true unto the day

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: As he to me: would he have stolen away

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: From sleeping Hermia? I'll believe as soon

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: This whole earth may be bored and that the moon

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: May through the centre creep and so displease

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Her brother's noontide with Antipodes.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: It cannot be but thou hast murder'd him;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: So should a murderer look, so dead, so grim.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: So should the murder'd look, and so should I,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Pierced through the heart with your stern cruelty:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Yet you, the murderer, look as bright, as clear,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: As yonder Venus in her glimmering sphere.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: What's this to my Lysander? where is he?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Ah, good Demetrius, wilt thou give him me?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: I had rather give his carcass to my hounds.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Out, dog! out, cur! thou drivest me past the bounds

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Of maiden's patience. Hast thou slain him, then?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Henceforth be never number'd among men!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: O, once tell true, tell true, even for my sake!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Durst thou have look'd upon him being awake,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And hast thou kill'd him sleeping? O brave touch!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Could not a worm, an adder, do so much?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: An adder did it; for with doubler tongue

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Than thine, thou serpent, never adder stung.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: You spend your passion on a misprised mood:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: I am not guilty of Lysander's blood;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Nor is he dead, for aught that I can tell.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I pray thee, tell me then that he is well.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: An if I could, what should I get therefore?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: A privilege never to see me more.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And from thy hated presence part I so:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: See me no more, whether he be dead or no.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: There is no following her in this fierce vein:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Here therefore for a while I will remain.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: So sorrow's heaviness doth heavier grow

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: For debt that bankrupt sleep doth sorrow owe:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Which now in some slight measure it will pay,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: If for his tender here I make some stay.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: What hast thou done? thou hast mistaken quite

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: And laid the love-juice on some true-love's sight:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Of thy misprision must perforce ensue

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Some true love turn'd and not a false turn'd true.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Then fate o'er-rules, that, one man holding troth,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: A million fail, confounding oath on oath.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: About the wood go swifter than the wind,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: And Helena of Athens look thou find:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: All fancy-sick she is and pale of cheer,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: With sighs of love, that costs the fresh blood dear:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: By some illusion see thou bring her here:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: I'll charm his eyes against she do appear.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: I go, I go; look how I go,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Swifter than arrow from the Tartar's bow.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Flower of this purple dye,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Hit with Cupid's archery,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Sink in apple of his eye.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: When his love he doth espy,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Let her shine as gloriously

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: As the Venus of the sky.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: When thou wakest, if she be by,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Beg of her for remedy.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Captain of our fairy band,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Helena is here at hand;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And the youth, mistook by me,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Pleading for a lover's fee.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Shall we their fond pageant see?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Lord, what fools these mortals be!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Stand aside: the noise they make

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Will cause Demetrius to awake.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Then will two at once woo one;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: That must needs be sport alone;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And those things do best please me

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: That befal preposterously.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Why should you think that I should woo in scorn?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Scorn and derision never come in tears:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Look, when I vow, I weep; and vows so born,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: In their nativity all truth appears.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: How can these things in me seem scorn to you,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Bearing the badge of faith, to prove them true?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: You do advance your cunning more and more.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: When truth kills truth, O devilish-holy fray!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: These vows are Hermia's: will you give her o'er?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Weigh oath with oath, and you will nothing weigh:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Your vows to her and me, put in two scales,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Will even weigh, and both as light as tales.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: I had no judgment when to her I swore.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Nor none, in my mind, now you give her o'er.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Demetrius loves her, and he loves not you.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Awaking  O Helena, goddess, nymph, perfect, divine!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: To what, my love, shall I compare thine eyne?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Crystal is muddy. O, how ripe in show

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Thy lips, those kissing cherries, tempting grow!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: That pure congealed white, high Taurus snow,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Fann'd with the eastern wind, turns to a crow

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: When thou hold'st up thy hand: O, let me kiss

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: This princess of pure white, this seal of bliss!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: O spite! O hell! I see you all are bent

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To set against me for your merriment:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: If you we re civil and knew courtesy,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: You would not do me thus much injury.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Can you not hate me, as I know you do,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: But you must join in souls to mock me too?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: If you were men, as men you are in show,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: You would not use a gentle lady so;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To vow, and swear, and superpraise my parts,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: When I am sure you hate me with your hearts.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: You both are rivals, and love Hermia;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: And now both rivals, to mock Helena:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: A trim exploit, a manly enterprise,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To conjure tears up in a poor maid's eyes

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: With your derision! none of noble sort

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Would so offend a virgin, and extort

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: A poor soul's patience, all to make you sport.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: You are unkind, Demetrius; be not so;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: For you love Hermia; this you know I know:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And here, with all good will, with all my heart,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: In Hermia's love I yield you up my part;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And yours of Helena to me bequeath,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Whom I do love and will do till my death.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Never did mockers waste more idle breath.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Lysander, keep thy Hermia; I will none:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: If e'er I loved her, all that love is gone.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: My heart to her but as guest-wise sojourn'd,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: And now to Helen is it home return'd,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: There to remain.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Helen, it is not so.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Disparage not the faith thou dost not know,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Lest, to thy peril, thou aby it dear.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Look, where thy love comes; yonder is thy dear.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Dark night, that from the eye his function takes,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: The ear more quick of apprehension makes;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Wherein it doth impair the seeing sense,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: It pays the hearing double recompense.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Thou art not by mine eye, Lysander, found;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Mine ear, I thank it, brought me to thy sound

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: But why unkindly didst thou leave me so?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Why should he stay, whom love doth press to go?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: What love could press Lysander from my side?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Lysander's love, that would not let him bide,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Fair Helena, who more engilds the night

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Than all you fiery oes and eyes of light.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Why seek'st thou me? could not this make thee know,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: The hate I bear thee made me leave thee so?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: You speak not as you think: it cannot be.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Lo, she is one of this confederacy!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Now I perceive they have conjoin'd all three

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To fashion this false sport, in spite of me.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Injurious Hermia! most ungrateful maid!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Have you conspired, have you with these contrived

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To bait me with this foul derision?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Is all the counsel that we two have shared,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: The sisters' vows, the hours that we have spent,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: When we have chid the hasty-footed time

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: For parting us,--O, is it all forgot?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: All school-days' friendship, childhood innocence?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: We, Hermia, like two artificial gods,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Have with our needles created both one flower,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Both on one sampler, sitting on one cushion,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Both warbling of one song, both in one key,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: As if our hands, our sides, voices and minds,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Had been incorporate. So we grow together,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Like to a double cherry, seeming parted,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: But yet an union in partition;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Two lovely berries moulded on one stem;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: So, with two seeming bodies, but one heart;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Two of the first, like coats in heraldry,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Due but to one and crowned with one crest.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: And will you rent our ancient love asunder,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To join with men in scorning your poor friend?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: It is not friendly, 'tis not maidenly:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Our sex, as well as I, may chide you for it,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Though I alone do feel the injury.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I am amazed at your passionate words.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I scorn you not: it seems that you scorn me.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Have you not set Lysander, as in scorn,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To follow me and praise my eyes and face?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: And made your other love, Demetrius,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Who even but now did spurn me with his foot,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To call me goddess, nymph, divine and rare,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Precious, celestial? Wherefore speaks he this

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To her he hates? and wherefore doth Lysander

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Deny your love, so rich within his soul,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: And tender me, forsooth, affection,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: But by your setting on, by your consent?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: What thought I be not so in grace as you,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: So hung upon with love, so fortunate,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: But miserable most, to love unloved?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: This you should pity rather than despise.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERNIA
line: I understand not what you mean by this.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Ay, do, persever, counterfeit sad looks,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Make mouths upon me when I turn my back;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Wink each at other; hold the sweet jest up:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: This sport, well carried, shall be chronicled.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: If you have any pity, grace, or manners,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: You would not make me such an argument.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: But fare ye well: 'tis partly my own fault;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Which death or absence soon shall remedy.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Stay, gentle Helena; hear my excuse:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: My love, my life my soul, fair Helena!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: O excellent!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Sweet, do not scorn her so.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: If she cannot entreat, I can compel.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Thou canst compel no more than she entreat:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Thy threats have no more strength than her weak prayers.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Helen, I love thee; by my life, I do:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: I swear by that which I will lose for thee,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: To prove him false that says I love thee not.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: I say I love thee more than he can do.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: If thou say so, withdraw, and prove it too.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Quick, come!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Lysander, whereto tends all this?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Away, you Ethiope!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: No, no; he'll

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Seem to break loose; take on as you would follow,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: But yet come not: you are a tame man, go!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Hang off, thou cat, thou burr! vile thing, let loose,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Or I will shake thee from me like a serpent!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Why are you grown so rude? what change is this?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Sweet love,--

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Thy love! out, tawny Tartar, out!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Out, loathed medicine! hated potion, hence!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Do you not jest?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Yes, sooth; and so do you.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Demetrius, I will keep my word with thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: I would I had your bond, for I perceive

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: A weak bond holds you: I'll not trust your word.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: What, should I hurt her, strike her, kill her dead?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Although I hate her, I'll not harm her so.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: What, can you do me greater harm than hate?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Hate me! wherefore? O me! what news, my love!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Am not I Hermia? are not you Lysander?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I am as fair now as I was erewhile.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Since night you loved me; yet since night you left

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: me:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Why, then you left me--O, the gods forbid!--

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: In earnest, shall I say?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Ay, by my life;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And never did desire to see thee more.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Therefore be out of hope, of question, of doubt;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Be certain, nothing truer; 'tis no jest

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: That I do hate thee and love Helena.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: O me! you juggler! you canker-blossom!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: You thief of love! what, have you come by night

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And stolen my love's heart from him?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Fine, i'faith!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Have you no modesty, no maiden shame,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: No touch of bashfulness? What, will you tear

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Impatient answers from my gentle tongue?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Fie, fie! you counterfeit, you puppet, you!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Puppet? why so? ay, that way goes the game.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Now I perceive that she hath made compare

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Between our statures; she hath urged her height;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And with her personage, her tall personage,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Her height, forsooth, she hath prevail'd with him.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: And are you grown so high in his esteem;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Because I am so dwarfish and so low?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: How low am I, thou painted maypole? speak;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: How low am I? I am not yet so low

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: But that my nails can reach unto thine eyes.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: I pray you, though you mock me, gentlemen,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Let her not hurt me: I was never curst;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: I have no gift at all in shrewishness;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: I am a right maid for my cowardice:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Let her not strike me. You perhaps may think,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Because she is something lower than myself,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: That I can match her.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Lower! hark, again.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Good Hermia, do not be so bitter with me.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: I evermore did love you, Hermia,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Did ever keep your counsels, never wrong'd you;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Save that, in love unto Demetrius,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: I told him of your stealth unto this wood.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: He follow'd you; for love I follow'd him;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: But he hath chid me hence and threaten'd me

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To strike me, spurn me, nay, to kill me too:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: And now, so you will let me quiet go,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: To Athens will I bear my folly back

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: And follow you no further: let me go:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: You see how simple and how fond I am.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Why, get you gone: who is't that hinders you?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: A foolish heart, that I leave here behind.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: What, with Lysander?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: With Demetrius.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Be not afraid; she shall not harm thee, Helena.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: No, sir, she shall not, though you take her part.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: O, when she's angry, she is keen and shrewd!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: She was a vixen when she went to school;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: And though she be but little, she is fierce.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: 'Little' again! nothing but 'low' and 'little'!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Why will you suffer her to flout me thus?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Let me come to her.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Get you gone, you dwarf;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: You minimus, of hindering knot-grass made;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: You bead, you acorn.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: You are too officious

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: In her behalf that scorns your services.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Let her alone: speak not of Helena;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Take not her part; for, if thou dost intend

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Never so little show of love to her,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Thou shalt aby it.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Now she holds me not;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Now follow, if thou darest, to try whose right,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Of thine or mine, is most in Helena.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Follow! nay, I'll go with thee, cheek by jole.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: You, mistress, all this coil is 'long of you:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Nay, go not back.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: I will not trust you, I,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Nor longer stay in your curst company.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Your hands than mine are quicker for a fray,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: My legs are longer though, to run away.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I am amazed, and know not what to say.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: This is thy negligence: still thou mistakest,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Or else committ'st thy knaveries wilfully.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Believe me, king of shadows, I mistook.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Did not you tell me I should know the man

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: By the Athenian garment be had on?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And so far blameless proves my enterprise,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: That I have 'nointed an Athenian's eyes;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And so far am I glad it so did sort

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: As this their jangling I esteem a sport.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Thou see'st these lovers seek a place to fight:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Hie therefore, Robin, overcast the night;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: The starry welkin cover thou anon

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: With drooping fog as black as Acheron,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: And lead these testy rivals so astray

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: As one come not within another's way.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Like to Lysander sometime frame thy tongue,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Then stir Demetrius up with bitter wrong;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: And sometime rail thou like Demetrius;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: And from each other look thou lead them thus,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Till o'er their brows death-counterfeiting sleep

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: With leaden legs and batty wings doth creep:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Then crush this herb into Lysander's eye;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Whose liquor hath this virtuous property,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: To take from thence all error with his might,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: And make his eyeballs roll with wonted sight.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: When they next wake, all this derision

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Shall seem a dream and fruitless vision,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: And back to Athens shall the lovers wend,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: With league whose date till death shall never end.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Whiles I in this affair do thee employ,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: I'll to my queen and beg her Indian boy;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: And then I will her charmed eye release

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: From monster's view, and all things shall be peace.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: My fairy lord, this must be done with haste,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: For night's swift dragons cut the clouds full fast,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And yonder shines Aurora's harbinger;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: At whose approach, ghosts, wandering here and there,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Troop home to churchyards: damned spirits all,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: That in crossways and floods have burial,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Already to their wormy beds are gone;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: For fear lest day should look their shames upon,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: They willfully themselves exile from light

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And must for aye consort with black-brow'd night.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: But we are spirits of another sort:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: I with the morning's love have oft made sport,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: And, like a forester, the groves may tread,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Even till the eastern gate, all fiery-red,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Opening on Neptune with fair blessed beams,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: Turns into yellow gold his salt green streams.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: But, notwithstanding, haste; make no delay:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: OBERON
line: We may effect this business yet ere day.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Up and down, up and down,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: I will lead them up and down:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: I am fear'd in field and town:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Goblin, lead them up and down.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Here comes one.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Where art thou, proud Demetrius? speak thou now.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Here, villain; drawn and ready. Where art thou?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: I will be with thee straight.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Follow me, then,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: To plainer ground.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Lysander! speak again:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Thou runaway, thou coward, art thou fled?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Speak! In some bush? Where dost thou hide thy head?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Thou coward, art thou bragging to the stars,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Telling the bushes that thou look'st for wars,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And wilt not come? Come, recreant; come, thou child;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: I'll whip thee with a rod: he is defiled

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: That draws a sword on thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Yea, art thou there?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Follow my voice: we'll try no manhood here.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: He goes before me and still dares me on:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: When I come where he calls, then he is gone.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: The villain is much lighter-heel'd than I:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: I follow'd fast, but faster he did fly;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: That fallen am I in dark uneven way,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: And here will rest me.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: Come, thou gentle day!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: For if but once thou show me thy grey light,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: LYSANDER
line: I'll find Demetrius and revenge this spite.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Ho, ho, ho! Coward, why comest thou not?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Abide me, if thou darest; for well I wot

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Thou runn'st before me, shifting every place,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: And darest not stand, nor look me in the face.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Where art thou now?

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Come hither: I am here.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Nay, then, thou mock'st me. Thou shalt buy this dear,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: If ever I thy face by daylight see:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Now, go thy way. Faintness constraineth me

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: To measure out my length on this cold bed.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: By day's approach look to be visited.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: O weary night, O long and tedious night,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Abate thy hour! Shine comforts from the east,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: That I may back to Athens by daylight,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: From these that my poor company detest:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: And sleep, that sometimes shuts up sorrow's eye,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HELENA
line: Steal me awhile from mine own company.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Yet but three? Come one more;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Two of both kinds make up four.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Here she comes, curst and sad:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Cupid is a knavish lad,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Thus to make poor females mad.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Never so weary, never so in woe,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Bedabbled with the dew and torn with briers,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: I can no further crawl, no further go;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: My legs can keep no pace with my desires.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Here will I rest me till the break of day.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: HERMIA
line: Heavens shield Lysander, if they mean a fray!

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: On the ground

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Sleep sound:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: I'll apply

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: To your eye,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Gentle lover, remedy.

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: When thou wakest,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Thou takest

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: True delight

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: In the sight

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Of thy former lady's eye:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: And the country proverb known,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: That every man should take his own,

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: In your waking shall be shown:

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Jack shall have Jill;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: Nought shall go ill;

scene: SCENE II.  Another part of the wood.
speaker: PUCK
line: The man shall have his mare again, and all shall be well.
